ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\%Public\%%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\%AppData\%%' ESCAPE '\') OR (NewValue LIKE '%:\\Users\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND (NewValue LIKE '%\\Favorites%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\\Favourites%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\\Contacts%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\\Music%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\\Pictures%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\\Documents%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\\Photos%' ESCAPE '\'))) AND (NOT (TargetObject LIKE '%\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\RunOnce\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND NewProcessName LIKE 'C:\\Windows\\SoftwareDistribution\\Download\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND (NewValue LIKE '%rundll32.exe %' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue LIKE '%C:\\WINDOWS\\system32\\advpack.dll,DelNodeRunDLL32%' ESCAPE '\') AND (NewValue LIKE '%\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%C:\\Windows\\Temp\\%' ESCAPE '\'))) AND (NOT ((NewProcessName LIKE '%C:\\Program Files\\Spotify\\Spotify.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Spotify\\Spotify.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\AppData\\Roaming\\Spotify\\Spotify.exe' ESCAPE '\') AND TargetObject LIKE '%SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\Run\\Spotify' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue LIKE '%Spotify.exe --autostart --minimized' ESCAPE '\'))))

title: Potential Persistence Via Outlook Home Page
description:
Detects potential persistence activity via outlook home page.
An attacker can set a home page to achieve code execution and persistence by editing the WebView registry keys.
author: Tobias Michalski (Nextron Systems), David Bertho (@dbertho) & Eirik Sveen (@0xSV1), Storebrand
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND ((TargetObject LIKE '%\\Software\\Microsoft\\Office\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND TargetObject LIKE '%\\Outlook\\WebView\\%' ESCAPE '\') AND TargetObject LIKE '%\\URL' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Potentially Suspicious Command Executed Via Run Dialog Box - Registry
description:
Detects execution of commands via the run dialog box on Windows by checking values of the "RunMRU" registry key.
This technique was seen being abused by threat actors to deceive users into pasting and executing malicious commands, often disguised as CAPTCHA verification steps.
author: Ahmed Farouk, Nasreddine Bencherchali
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\Explorer\\RunMRU%' ESCAPE '\' AND (((NewValue LIKE '%powershell%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%pwsh%' ESCAPE '\') AND (NewValue LIKE '% -e %' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '% -ec %' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '% -en %' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '% -enc %' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '% -enco%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%ftp%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%Hidden%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%http%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%iex%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%Invoke-%' ESCAPE '\')) OR (NewValue LIKE '%wmic%' ESCAPE '\' AND (NewValue LIKE '%shadowcopy%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%process call create%' ESCAPE '\')))))

title: Potential WerFault ReflectDebugger Registry Value Abuse
description: Detects potential WerFault "ReflectDebugger" registry value abuse for persistence.
author: X__Junior
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND TargetObject LIKE '%\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Windows Error Reporting\\Hangs\\ReflectDebugger' ESCAPE '\')

title: Potential Persistence Via GlobalFlags
description: Detects registry persistence technique using the GlobalFlags and SilentProcessExit keys
author: Karneades, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Florian Roth
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND ((TargetObject LIKE '%\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND TargetObject LIKE '%\\Image File Execution Options\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND TargetObject LIKE '%\\GlobalFlag%' ESCAPE '\') OR ((TargetObject LIKE '%\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND TargetObject LIKE '%\\SilentProcessExit\\%' ESCAPE '\') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\ReportingMode%' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\MonitorProcess%' ESCAPE '\'))))

title: Python Function Execution Security Warning Disabled In Excel - Registry
description:
Detects changes to the registry value "PythonFunctionWarnings" that would prevent any warnings or alerts from showing when Python functions are about to be executed.
Threat actors could run malicious code through the new Microsoft Excel feature that allows Python to run within the spreadsheet.
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), @Kostastsale
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\Microsoft\\Office\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND TargetObject LIKE '%\\Excel\\Security\\PythonFunctionWarnings' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue='DWORD (0x00000001)'))

title: Hide Schedule Task Via Index Value Tamper
description:
Detects when the "index" value of a scheduled task is modified from the registry
Which effectively hides it from any tooling such as "schtasks /query" (Read the referenced link for more information about the effects of this technique)
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND ((TargetObject LIKE '%\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\Schedule\\TaskCache\\Tree\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND TargetObject LIKE '%Index%' ESCAPE '\') AND NewValue='DWORD (0x00000000)'))

title: Registry Modification for OCI DLL Redirection
description:
Detects registry modifications related to 'OracleOciLib' and 'OracleOciLibPath' under 'MSDTC' settings.
Threat actors may modify these registry keys to redirect the loading of 'oci.dll' to a malicious DLL, facilitating phantom DLL hijacking via the MSDTC service.
author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND ((TargetObject LIKE '%\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\MSDTC\\MTxOCI\\OracleOciLib' ESCAPE '\' AND (NOT NewValue LIKE '%oci.dll%' ESCAPE '\')) OR (TargetObject LIKE '%\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\MSDTC\\MTxOCI\\OracleOciLibPath' ESCAPE '\' AND (NOT NewValue LIKE '%\%SystemRoot\%\\System32\\%' ESCAPE '\'))))

title: Potential CobaltStrike Service Installations - Registry
description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement.
author: Wojciech Lesicki
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND ((TargetObject LIKE '%\\System\\CurrentControlSet\\Services%' ESCAPE '\' OR (TargetObject LIKE '%\\System\\ControlSet%' ESCAPE '\' AND TargetObject LIKE '%\\Services%' ESCAPE '\')) AND ((NewValue LIKE '%ADMIN$%' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue LIKE '%.exe%' ESCAPE '\') OR (NewValue LIKE '%\%COMSPEC\%%' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue LIKE '%start%' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue LIKE '%powershell%' ESCAPE '\'))))

title: Suspicious Environment Variable Has Been Registered
description: Detects the creation of user-specific or system-wide environment variables via the registry. Which contains suspicious commands and strings
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\Environment\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND ((NewValue='powershell' OR NewValue='pwsh') OR (NewValue LIKE '%\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%C:\\Users\\Public\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%TVqQAAMAAAAEAAAA%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%TVpQAAIAAAAEAA8A%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%TVqAAAEAAAAEABAA%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%TVoAAAAAAAAAAAAA%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%TVpTAQEAAAAEAAAA%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%SW52b2tlL%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%ludm9rZS%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%JbnZva2Ut%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%SQBuAHYAbwBrAGUALQ%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%kAbgB2AG8AawBlAC0A%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%JAG4AdgBvAGsAZQAtA%' ESCAPE '\') OR (NewValue LIKE 'SUVY%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'SQBFAF%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'SQBuAH%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'cwBhA%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'aWV4%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'aQBlA%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'R2V0%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'dmFy%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'dgBhA%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'dXNpbm%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'H4sIA%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'Y21k%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'cABhAH%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'Qzpc%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE 'Yzpc%' ESCAPE '\'))))

title: DHCP Callout DLL Installation
description: Detects the installation of a Callout DLL via CalloutDlls and CalloutEnabled parameter in Registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DHCP server (restart required)
author: Dimitrios Slamaris
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\Services\\DHCPServer\\Parameters\\CalloutDlls' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\Services\\DHCPServer\\Parameters\\CalloutEnabled' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Add Debugger Entry To Hangs Key For Persistence
description: Detects when an attacker adds a new "Debugger" value to the "Hangs" key in order to achieve persistence which will get invoked when an application crashes
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
falsepositives: This value is not set by default but could be rarly used by administrators
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND TargetObject LIKE '%\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Windows Error Reporting\\Hangs\\Debugger%' ESCAPE '\')

title: Suspicious Application Allowed Through Exploit Guard
description: Detects applications being added to the "allowed applications" list of exploit guard in order to bypass controlled folder settings
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows Defender\\Windows Defender Exploit Guard\\Controlled Folder Access\\AllowedApplications%' ESCAPE '\' AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\Users\\Public\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\Desktop\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\PerfLogs\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\Windows\\Temp\\%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Bypass UAC Using DelegateExecute
description: Bypasses User Account Control using a fileless method
author: frack113
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\open\\command\\DelegateExecute' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue='(Empty)'))

title: Hypervisor Enforced Paging Translation Disabled
description: Detects changes to the "DisableHypervisorEnforcedPagingTranslation" registry value. Where the it is set to "1" in order to disable the Hypervisor Enforced Paging Translation feature.
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\DisableHypervisorEnforcedPagingTranslation' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue='DWORD (0x00000001)'))

title: Suspicious Shim Database Patching Activity
description: Detects installation of new shim databases that try to patch sections of known processes for potential process injection or persistence.
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\AppCompatFlags\\Custom\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\csrss.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\dllhost.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\explorer.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\RuntimeBroker.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\services.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\sihost.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\svchost.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\taskhostw.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\winlogon.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\WmiPrvSe.exe' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Disabled Windows Defender Eventlog
description: Detects the disabling of the Windows Defender eventlog as seen in relation to Lockbit 3.0 infections
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
falsepositives: Other Antivirus software installations could cause Windows to disable that eventlog (unknown)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\WINEVT\\Channels\\Microsoft-Windows-Windows Defender/Operational\\Enabled%' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue='DWORD (0x00000000)'))

title: Potential EventLog File Location Tampering
description: Detects tampering with EventLog service "file" key. In order to change the default location of an Evtx file. This technique is used to tamper with log collection and alerting
author: D3F7A5105
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND ((TargetObject LIKE '%\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\EventLog\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND TargetObject LIKE '%\\File' ESCAPE '\') AND (NOT NewValue LIKE '%\\System32\\Winevt\\Logs\\%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Macro Enabled In A Potentially Suspicious Document
description: Detects registry changes to Office trust records where the path is located in a potentially suspicious location
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\Security\\Trusted Documents\\TrustRecords%' ESCAPE '\' AND (TargetObject LIKE '%/AppData/Local/Microsoft/Windows/INetCache/%' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%/AppData/Local/Temp/%' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%/PerfLogs/%' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%C:/Users/Public/%' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%file:///D:/%' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%file:///E:/%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Office Macros Warning Disabled
description: Detects registry changes to Microsoft Office "VBAWarning" to a value of "1" which enables the execution of all macros, whether signed or unsigned.
author: Trent Liffick (@tliffick), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\Security\\VBAWarnings' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue='DWORD (0x00000001)'))

title: Bypass UAC Using Event Viewer
description: Bypasses User Account Control using Event Viewer and a relevant Windows Registry modification
author: frack113
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\_Classes\\mscfile\\shell\\open\\command\\(Default)' ESCAPE '\' AND (NOT NewValue LIKE '\%SystemRoot\%\\system32\\mmc.exe "\%1" \%%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: UAC Bypass Using Windows Media Player - Registry
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Windows Media Player osksupport.dll (UACMe 32)
author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\AppCompatFlags\\Compatibility Assistant\\Store\\C:\\Program Files\\Windows Media Player\\osk.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue='Binary Data'))

title: Potential Persistence Via App Paths Default Property
description:
Detects changes to the "Default" property for keys located in the \Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\App Paths\ registry. Which might be used as a method of persistence
The entries found under App Paths are used primarily for the following purposes.
First, to map an application's executable file name to that file's fully qualified path.
Second, to prepend information to the PATH environment variable on a per-application, per-process basis.
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
falsepositives: Legitimate applications registering their binary from on of the suspicious locations mentioned above (tune it)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\App Paths%' ESCAPE '\' AND (TargetObject LIKE '%(Default)' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%Path' ESCAPE '\') AND (NewValue LIKE '%\\Users\\Public%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\\Windows\\Temp\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\\Desktop\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\\Downloads\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\%temp\%%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\%tmp\%%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%iex%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%Invoke-%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%rundll32%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%regsvr32%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%mshta%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%cscript%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%wscript%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%.bat%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%.hta%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%.dll%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%.ps1%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Windows Vulnerable Driver Blocklist Disabled
description:
Detects when the Windows Vulnerable Driver Blocklist is set to disabled. This setting is crucial for preventing the loading of known vulnerable drivers,
and its modification may indicate an attempt to bypass security controls. It is often targeted by threat actors to facilitate the installation of malicious or vulnerable drivers,
particularly in scenarios involving Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) bypass techniques.
This rule applies to systems that support the Vulnerable Driver Blocklist feature, including Windows 10 version 1903 and later, and Windows Server 2022 and later.
Note that this change will require a reboot to take effect, and this rule only detects the registry modification action.
author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)
falsepositives: Unlikely and should be investigated immediately.
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\Control\\CI\\Config\\VulnerableDriverBlocklistEnable' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue='DWORD (0x00000000)'))

title: Suspicious Printer Driver Empty Manufacturer
description: Detects a suspicious printer driver installation with an empty Manufacturer value
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
falsepositives: Alerts on legitimate printer drivers that do not set any more details in the Manufacturer value
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (((TargetObject LIKE '%\\Control\\Print\\Environments\\Windows x64\\Drivers%' ESCAPE '\' AND TargetObject LIKE '%\\Manufacturer%' ESCAPE '\') AND NewValue='(Empty)') AND (NOT (TargetObject LIKE '%\\CutePDF Writer v4.0\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR (TargetObject LIKE '%\\VNC Printer (PS)\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\VNC Printer (UD)\\%' ESCAPE '\') OR TargetObject LIKE '%\\Version-3\\PDF24\\%' ESCAPE '\'))))

title: Antivirus Filter Driver Disallowed On Dev Drive - Registry
description: Detects activity that indicates a user disabling the ability for Antivirus mini filter to inspect a "Dev Drive".
author: @kostastsale, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\FilterManager\\FltmgrDevDriveAllowAntivirusFilter' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue='DWORD (0x00000000)'))

title: New File Association Using Exefile
description: Detects the abuse of the exefile handler in new file association. Used for bypass of security products.
author: Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND (TargetObject LIKE '%Classes\\.%' ESCAPE '\' AND NewValue='exefile'))

title: Scheduled Tasks Names Used By SVR For GraphicalProton Backdoor
description: Hunts for known SVR-specific scheduled task names
author: CISA
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4698 OR EventID=4699 OR EventID=4702) AND (TaskName LIKE '\\defender' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\DefenderService' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Application Experience\\StartupAppTaskCheck' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Application Experience\\StartupAppTaskCkeck' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\ATPUpd' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Data Integrity Scan\\Data Integrity Update' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\DefenderUPDService' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\IISUpdateService' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Speech\\SpeechModelInstallTask' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\WiMSDFS' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Windows Defender\\Defender Update Service' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Windows Defender\\Service Update' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Windows Error Reporting\\CheckReporting' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Windows Error Reporting\\SubmitReporting' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Windows Filtering Platform\\BfeOnServiceStart' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\WindowsDefenderService' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\WindowsDefenderService2' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\WindowsUpdate\\Scheduled AutoCheck' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\WindowsUpdate\\Scheduled Check' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\WindowUpdate' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Scheduled Tasks Names Used By SVR For GraphicalProton Backdoor - Task Scheduler
description: Hunts for known SVR-specific scheduled task names
author: CISA
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Microsoft-Windows-TaskScheduler/Operational' AND ((EventID=129 OR EventID=140 OR EventID=141) AND (TaskName LIKE '\\defender' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\DefenderService' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Application Experience\\StartupAppTaskCheck' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Application Experience\\StartupAppTaskCkeck' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\ATPUpd' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Data Integrity Scan\\Data Integrity Update' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\DefenderUPDService' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\IISUpdateService' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Speech\\SpeechModelInstallTask' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\WiMSDFS' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Windows Defender\\Defender Update Service' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Windows Defender\\Service Update' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Windows Error Reporting\\CheckReporting' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Windows Error Reporting\\SubmitReporting' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Windows Filtering Platform\\BfeOnServiceStart' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\WindowsDefenderService' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\WindowsDefenderService2' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\WindowsUpdate\\Scheduled AutoCheck' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\Microsoft\\Windows\\WindowsUpdate\\Scheduled Check' ESCAPE '\' OR TaskName LIKE '\\WindowUpdate' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Potential APT Mustang Panda Activity Against Australian Gov
description: Detects specific command line execution used by Mustang Panda in a targeted attack against the Australian government as reported by Lab52
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((CommandLine LIKE '%copy SolidPDFCreator.dll%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%C:\\Users\\Public\\Libraries\\PhotoTvRHD\\SolidPDFCreator.dll%' ESCAPE '\') OR (CommandLine LIKE '%reg %' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\Run%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%SolidPDF%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%C:\\Users\\Public\\Libraries\\PhotoTvRHD\\%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Peach Sandstorm APT Process Activity Indicators
description: Detects process creation activity related to Peach Sandstorm APT
author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND CommandLine LIKE '%QP''s*(58vaP!tF4%' ESCAPE '\')

title: Diamond Sleet APT Process Activity Indicators
description: Detects process creation activity indicators related to Diamond Sleet APT
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND CommandLine LIKE '% uTYNkfKxHiZrx3KJ%' ESCAPE '\')

title: Diamond Sleet APT Scheduled Task Creation - Registry
description: Detects registry event related to the creation of a scheduled task used by Diamond Sleet APT during exploitation of Team City CVE-2023-42793 vulnerability
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND (OperationType='New registry value created' OR OperationType='Existing registry value modified')) AND (TargetObject LIKE '%\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\Schedule\\TaskCache\\Tree\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND TargetObject LIKE '%Windows TeamCity Settings User Interface%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: PaperCut MF/NG Potential Exploitation
description: Detects suspicious child processes of "pc-app.exe". Which could indicate potential exploitation of PaperCut
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Huntress DE&TH Team (idea)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\pc-app.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\bash.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\calc.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\certutil.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cmd.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\csc.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cscript.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\dllhost.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\mshta.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\msiexec.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\powershell.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\pwsh.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\regsvr32.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\rundll32.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\scriptrunner.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\wmic.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\wscript.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\wsl.exe' ESCAPE '\')))

title: PaperCut MF/NG Exploitation Related Indicators
description: Detects exploitation indicators related to PaperCut MF/NG Exploitation
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((CommandLine LIKE '% /c %' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%powershell%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%-nop -w hidden%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%Invoke-WebRequest%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%setup.msi%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%-OutFile%' ESCAPE '\') OR (CommandLine LIKE '%msiexec %' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%/i %' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%setup.msi %' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%/qn %' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%IntegratorLogin=fimaribahundq%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Potential POWERTRASH Script Execution
description: Detects potential execution of the PowerShell script POWERTRASH
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE (Channel='Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell/Operational' OR Channel='PowerShellCore/Operational') AND (EventID=4104 AND (ScriptBlockText LIKE '%IO.Compression.DeflateStream%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%IO.MemoryStream%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%::FromBase64String%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%GetDelegateForFunctionPointer%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%.Invoke()%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%GlobalAssemblyCache%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Potential APT FIN7 POWERHOLD Execution
description: Detects execution of the POWERHOLD script seen used by FIN7 as reported by WithSecureLabs
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE (Channel='Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell/Operational' OR Channel='PowerShellCore/Operational') AND (EventID=4104 AND (ScriptBlockText LIKE '%$env:APPDATA%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%function MainPayload%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%::WriteAllBytes%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%wscript.exe%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Potential APT FIN7 Reconnaissance/POWERTRASH Related Activity
description: Detects specific command line execution used by FIN7 as reported by WithSecureLabs for reconnaissance and POWERTRASH execution
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((CommandLine LIKE '%-noni -nop -exe bypass -f \\\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%ADMIN$%' ESCAPE '\') OR (CommandLine LIKE '%-ex bypass -noprof -nolog -nonint -f%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%C:\\Windows\\Temp\\%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Potential Compromised 3CXDesktopApp Update Activity
description: Detects the 3CXDesktopApp updater downloading a known compromised version of the 3CXDesktopApp software
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\3CXDesktopApp\\app\\update.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (CommandLine LIKE '%--update%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%http%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%/electron/update/win32/18.12%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Potential Suspicious Child Process Of 3CXDesktopApp
description: Detects potential suspicious child processes of "3CXDesktopApp.exe". Which could be related to the 3CXDesktopApp supply chain compromise
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\3CXDesktopApp.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cmd.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cscript.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\mshta.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\powershell.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\pwsh.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\regsvr32.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\rundll32.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\wscript.exe' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Potential Compromised 3CXDesktopApp Execution
description: Detects execution of known compromised version of 3CXDesktopApp
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (((OriginalFileName='3CXDesktopApp.exe' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\3CXDesktopApp.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR Product='3CX Desktop App') AND FileVersion LIKE '%18.12.%' ESCAPE '\') OR (Hashes LIKE '%SHA256=DDE03348075512796241389DFEA5560C20A3D2A2EAC95C894E7BBED5E85A0ACC%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA256=54004DFAA48CA5FA91E3304FB99559A2395301C570026450882D6AAD89132A02%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA256=D45674F941BE3CCA2FBC1AF42778043CC18CD86D95A2ECB9E6F0E212ED4C74AE%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA1=480DC408EF50BE69EBCF84B95750F7E93A8A1859%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA1=3B43A5D8B83C637D00D769660D01333E88F5A187%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA1=6285FFB5F98D35CD98E78D48B63A05AF6E4E4DEA%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%MD5=BB915073385DD16A846DFA318AFA3C19%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%MD5=08D79E1FFFA244CC0DC61F7D2036ACA9%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%MD5=4965EDF659753E3C05D800C6C8A23A7A%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA256=FAD482DED2E25CE9E1DD3D3ECC3227AF714BDFBBDE04347DBC1B21D6A3670405%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA256=5D99EFA36F34AA6B43CD81E77544961C5C8D692C96059FEF92C2DF2624550734%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA256=A60A61BF844BC181D4540C9FAC53203250A982E7C3AD6153869F01E19CC36203%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA1=E272715737B51C01DC2BED0F0AEE2BF6FEEF25F1%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA1=8433A94AEDB6380AC8D4610AF643FB0E5220C5CB%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA1=413D9CBFCBF8D1E8304EAB0AA5484F5EEC5185F5%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%MD5=9833A4779B69B38E3E51F04E395674C6%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%MD5=704DB9184700481A56E5100FB56496CE%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%MD5=8EE6802F085F7A9DF7E0303E65722DC0%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA256=AA124A4B4DF12B34E74EE7F6C683B2EBEC4CE9A8EDCF9BE345823B4FDCF5D868%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA256=59E1EDF4D82FAE4978E97512B0331B7EB21DD4B838B850BA46794D9C7A2C0983%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA1=BEA77D1E59CF18DCE22AD9A2FAD52948FD7A9EFA%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA1=BFECB8CE89A312D2EF4AFC64A63847AE11C6F69E%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%MD5=F3D4144860CA10BA60F7EF4D176CC736%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%MD5=0EEB1C0133EB4D571178B2D9D14CE3E9%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Lace Tempest PowerShell Launcher
description: Detects a PowerShell script used by Lace Tempest APT to launch their malware loader by exploiting CVE-2023-47246 as reported by SysAid Team
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE (Channel='Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell/Operational' OR Channel='PowerShellCore/Operational') AND (EventID=4104 AND (ScriptBlockText LIKE '%\\SysAidServer\\tomcat\\webapps%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%Starting user.exe%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%\\usersfiles\\user.exe%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%Remove-Item -Force "$wapps%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%(Sophos).%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Lace Tempest PowerShell Evidence Eraser
description: Detects a PowerShell script used by Lace Tempest APT to erase evidence from victim servers by exploiting CVE-2023-47246 as reported by SysAid Team
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE (Channel='Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell/Operational' OR Channel='PowerShellCore/Operational') AND (EventID=4104 AND (ScriptBlockText LIKE '%cleanLL%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%usersfiles.war%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%Remove-Item -Path "$tomcat\_dir%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%SysAidServer%' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%sleep %' ESCAPE '\' AND ScriptBlockText LIKE '%while(1)%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Lace Tempest Cobalt Strike Download
description: Detects specific command line execution used by Lace Tempest to download Cobalt Strike as reported by SysAid Team
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (CommandLine LIKE '%-nop -w hidden -c IEX ((new-object net.webclient).downloadstring(%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%/a'')%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Lace Tempest Malware Loader Execution
description: Detects execution of a specific binary based on filename and hash used by Lace Tempest to load additional malware as reported by SysAid Team
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (NewProcessName LIKE '%:\\Program Files\\SysAidServer\\tomcat\\webapps\\usersfiles\\user.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA256=B5ACF14CDAC40BE590318DEE95425D0746E85B1B7B1CBD14DA66F21F2522BF4D%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Mint Sandstorm - Log4J Wstomcat Process Execution
description: Detects Log4J Wstomcat process execution as seen in Mint Sandstorm activity
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), MSTIC (idea)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\ws\_tomcatservice.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (NOT NewProcessName LIKE '%\\repadmin.exe' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Potential Pikabot Hollowing Activity
description:
Detects the execution of rundll32 that leads to the invocation of legitimate Windows binaries.
The malware Pikabot has been seen to use this technique for process hollowing through hard-coded Windows binaries
author: Andreas Braathen (mnemonic.io)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\rundll32.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\SearchFilterHost.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\SearchProtocolHost.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\sndvol.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\wermgr.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\wwahost.exe' ESCAPE '\')) AND (NOT (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\sndvol.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND ParentCommandLine LIKE '%mmsys.cpl%' ESCAPE '\'))))

title: Pikabot Fake DLL Extension Execution Via Rundll32.EXE
description: Detects specific process tree behavior linked to "rundll32" executions, wherein the associated DLL lacks a common ".dll" extension, often signaling potential Pikabot activity.
author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (((ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\cmd.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\cscript.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\mshta.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\powershell.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\pwsh.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\regsvr32.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\wscript.exe' ESCAPE '\') AND NewProcessName LIKE '%\\rundll32.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (CommandLine LIKE '%:\\ProgramData\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%:\\Users\\Public\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%:\\Windows\\Installer\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%\\AppData\\Roaming\\%' ESCAPE '\')) AND (NOT ((CommandLine LIKE '%.cpl %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.cpl,%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.dll %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.dll,%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.inf %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.inf,%' ESCAPE '\') OR (CommandLine LIKE '%.cpl' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.cpl"' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.dll' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.dll"' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.inf' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.inf"' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.cpl''' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.dll''' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.inf''' ESCAPE '\')))))

title: Potential Pikabot Discovery Activity
description:
Detects system discovery activity carried out by Pikabot, such as incl. network, user info and domain groups.
The malware Pikabot has been seen to use this technique as part of its C2-botnet registration with a short collection time frame (less than 1 minute).
author: Andreas Braathen (mnemonic.io)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((GrandParentImage LIKE '%\\rundll32.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\SearchFilterHost.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\SearchProtocolHost.exe' ESCAPE '\')) AND (CommandLine='ipconfig.exe /all' OR CommandLine='netstat.exe -aon' OR CommandLine='whoami.exe /all')))

title: Injected Browser Process Spawning Rundll32 - GuLoader Activity
description:
Detects the execution of installed GuLoader malware on the host.
GuLoader is initiating network connections via the rundll32.exe process that is spawned via a browser parent(injected) process.
author: @kostastsale
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\chrome.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\firefox.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\msedge.exe' ESCAPE '\') AND NewProcessName LIKE '%\\rundll32.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%\\rundll32.exe' ESCAPE '\'))

title: IcedID Malware Suspicious Single Digit DLL Execution Via Rundll32
description: Detects RunDLL32.exe executing a single digit DLL named "1.dll" with the export function "DllRegisterServer". This behaviour was often seen used by malware and especially IcedID
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\rundll32.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (CommandLine LIKE '%\\1.dll, DllRegisterServer' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '% 1.dll, DllRegisterServer' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Potential SNAKE Malware Installation Binary Indicator
description: Detects a specific binary name seen used by SNAKE malware during its installation as described by CISA in their report
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((NewProcessName LIKE '%\\jpsetup.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\jpinst.exe' ESCAPE '\') AND (NOT ((CommandLine='jpinst.exe' OR CommandLine='jpinst' OR CommandLine='jpsetup.exe' OR CommandLine='jpsetup') OR CommandLine='' OR CommandLine IS NULL))))

title: SNAKE Malware Covert Store Registry Key
description: Detects any registry event that targets the key 'SECURITY\Policy\Secrets\n' which is a key related to SNAKE malware as described by CISA
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND (OperationType='New registry value created' OR OperationType='Existing registry value modified')) AND TargetObject LIKE '%SECURITY\\Policy\\Secrets\\n' ESCAPE '\')

title: Potential SNAKE Malware Persistence Service Execution
description: Detects a specific child/parent process relationship indicative of a "WerFault" process running from the "WinSxS" as a service. This could be indicative of potential SNAKE malware activity as reported by CISA.
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\services.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND NewProcessName LIKE 'C:\\Windows\\WinSxS\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND NewProcessName LIKE '%\\WerFault.exe' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Potential SNAKE Malware Installation CLI Arguments Indicator
description: Detects a specific command line arguments sequence seen used by SNAKE malware during its installation as described by CISA in their report
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND CommandLine REGEXP '\s[a-fA-F0-9]{64}\s[a-fA-F0-9]{16}')

title: Potential Qakbot Rundll32 Execution
description: Detects specific process tree behavior of a "rundll32" execution often linked with potential Qakbot activity.
author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (((ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\cmd.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\cscript.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\curl.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\mshta.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\powershell.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\pwsh.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\wscript.exe' ESCAPE '\') AND NewProcessName LIKE '%\\rundll32.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (CommandLine LIKE '%:\\ProgramData\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%:\\Users\\Public\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%\\AppData\\Roaming\\%' ESCAPE '\')) AND CommandLine LIKE '%.dll%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Qakbot Regsvr32 Calc Pattern
description: Detects a specific command line of "regsvr32" where the "calc" keyword is used in conjunction with the "/s" flag. This behavior is often seen used by Qakbot
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\regsvr32.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (CommandLine LIKE '% -s%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '% /s%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '% –s%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '% —s%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '% ―s%' ESCAPE '\') AND CommandLine LIKE '% calc' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Qakbot Uninstaller Execution
description: Detects the execution of the Qakbot uninstaller file mentioned in the USAO-CDCA document on the disruption of the Qakbot malware and botnet
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\QbotUninstall.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR (Hashes LIKE '%IMPHASH=E772C815072311D6FB8C3390743E6BE5%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA256=423A9D13D410E2DC38EABB9FDF3121D2072472D0426260283A638B822DCD5180%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA256=559CAE635F0D870652B9482EF436B31D4BB1A5A0F51750836F328D749291D0B6%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA256=855EB5481F77DDE5AD8FA6E9D953D4AEBC280DDDF9461144B16ED62817CC5071%' ESCAPE '\' OR Hashes LIKE '%SHA256=FAB408536AA37C4ABC8BE97AB9C1F86CB33B63923D423FDC2859EB9D63FA8EA0%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Ursnif Redirection Of Discovery Commands
description: Detects the redirection of Ursnif discovery commands as part of the initial execution of the malware.
author: @kostastsale
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\explorer.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cmd.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (CommandLine LIKE '%/C %' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '% >> %\\AppData\\local\\temp*.bin%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: DarkGate - User Created Via Net.EXE
description: Detects creation of local users via the net.exe command with the name of "DarkGate"
author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((NewProcessName LIKE '%\\net.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\net1.exe' ESCAPE '\') AND (CommandLine LIKE '%user%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%add%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%DarkGate%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%SafeMode%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: DarkGate - Autoit3.EXE Execution Parameters
description:
Detects execution of the legitimate Autoit3 utility from a suspicious parent process. AutoIt3.exe is used within
the DarkGate infection chain to execute shellcode that performs process injection and connects to the DarkGate
command-and-control server.
author: Micah Babinski
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (((NewProcessName LIKE '%\\Autoit3.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR OriginalFileName='AutoIt3.exe') AND (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\cmd.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\KeyScramblerLogon.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\msiexec.exe' ESCAPE '\')) AND (NOT (NewProcessName LIKE '%:\\Program Files (x86)\\AutoIt3\\AutoIt3.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%:\\Program Files\\AutoIt3\\AutoIt3.exe' ESCAPE '\'))))

title: COLDSTEEL Persistence Service Creation
description: Detects the creation of new services potentially related to COLDSTEEL RAT
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='System' AND (Provider_Name='Service Control Manager' AND EventID=7045 AND (ServiceName='Name' OR ServiceName='msupdate' OR ServiceName='msupdate2') AND ImagePath LIKE '%\\Windows\\System32\\svchost.exe%' ESCAPE '\')

title: COLDSTEEL RAT Anonymous User Process Execution
description: Detects the creation of a process executing as user called "ANONYMOUS" seen used by the "MileStone2016" variant of COLDSTEEL
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\Windows\\System32\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\AppData\\%' ESCAPE '\') AND User LIKE '%ANONYMOUS%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Potential COLDSTEEL RAT Windows User Creation
description: Detects creation of a new user profile with a specific username, seen being used by some variants of the COLDSTEEL RAT.
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='Existing registry value modified') AND ((TargetObject LIKE '%\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\ProfileList\\S-1-5-21-%' ESCAPE '\' AND TargetObject LIKE '%\\ProfileImagePath%' ESCAPE '\') AND (NewValue LIKE '%ANONYMOUS%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewValue LIKE '%\_DomainUser\_%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Potential CVE-2023-36884 Exploitation - Share Access
description: Detects access to a file share with a naming schema seen being used during exploitation of CVE-2023-36884
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=5140 AND ((ShareName LIKE '%\\MSHTML\_C7\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND ShareName REGEXP '[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}') OR (ShareLocalPath LIKE '%\\MSHTML\_C7\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND ShareLocalPath REGEXP '[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}')))

title: Potential CVE-2023-36874 Exploitation - Fake Wermgr Execution
description: Detects the execution of a renamed "cmd", "powershell" or "powershell_ise" binary. Attackers were seen using these binaries in a renamed form as "wermgr.exe" in exploitation of CVE-2023-36874
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((OriginalFileName='Cmd.Exe' OR OriginalFileName LIKE 'powershell\_ise.EXE' ESCAPE '\' OR OriginalFileName='powershell.exe') AND NewProcessName LIKE '%\\wermgr.exe' ESCAPE '\'))

title: MSMQ Corrupted Packet Encountered
description: Detects corrupted packets sent to the MSMQ service. Could potentially be a sign of CVE-2023-21554 exploitation
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Application' AND (Provider_Name='MSMQ' AND EventID=2027 AND Level=2)

title: Potential Exploitation Attempt Of Undocumented WindowsServer RCE
description: Detects potential exploitation attempt of undocumented Windows Server Pre Auth Remote Code Execution (RCE)
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\svchost.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND NewProcessName LIKE '%\\svchost.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND ParentCommandLine LIKE '%-k DHCPServer%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%-k DHCPServer%' ESCAPE '\' AND (User LIKE '%NETWORK SERVICE%' ESCAPE '\' OR User LIKE '%NETZWERKDIENST%' ESCAPE '\' OR User LIKE '%SERVIZIO DI RETE%' ESCAPE '\' OR User LIKE '%SERVICIO DE RED%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: CVE-2023-38331 Exploitation Attempt - Suspicious WinRAR Child Process
description: Detects exploitation attempt of CVE-2023-38331 (WinRAR before v6.23), where an attacker can leverage WinRAR to execute arbitrary commands and binaries.
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Andreas Braathen (mnemonic.io)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\WinRAR.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\Rar$%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine REGEXP '\.[a-zA-Z0-9]{1,4} \.' AND ((NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cmd.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cscript.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\powershell.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\pwsh.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\wscript.exe' ESCAPE '\') OR (OriginalFileName='Cmd.Exe' OR OriginalFileName='cscript.exe' OR OriginalFileName='PowerShell.EXE' OR OriginalFileName='pwsh.dll' OR OriginalFileName='wscript.exe'))))

title: Kalambur Backdoor Curl TOR SOCKS Proxy Execution
description: Detects the execution of the "curl.exe" command, referencing "SOCKS" and ".onion" domains, which could be indicative of Kalambur backdoor activity.
author: Arda Buyukkaya (EclecticIQ)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\curl.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (CommandLine LIKE '%socks5h://%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%socks5://%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%socks4a://%' ESCAPE '\') AND CommandLine LIKE '%.onion%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Grixba Malware Reconnaissance Activity
description:
Detects execution of the Grixba reconnaissance tool based on suspicious command-line parameter combinations.
This tool is used by the Play ransomware group for network enumeration, data gathering, and event log clearing.
author: yxinmiracle, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)
falsepositives: Legitimate tools that use similar command-line argument structures (e.g., a tool with '--mode scan' and '--input file.txt') could trigger this rule. However, the specific combinations are indicative of reconnaissance or defense evasion.
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((CommandLine LIKE '%-m %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%-mode %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%-m:%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%-mode:%' ESCAPE '\') AND (CommandLine LIKE '%-i %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%-input %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%-i:%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%-input:%' ESCAPE '\') AND (CommandLine LIKE '%scan %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%scanall %' ESCAPE '\') AND (CommandLine LIKE '%:f %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%:r %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%:s %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '% f %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '% r %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '% s %' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Commvault QOperation Path Traversal Webshell Drop (CVE-2025-57790)
description:
Detects the use of qoperation.exe with the -file argument to write a JSP file to the webroot, indicating a webshell drop.
This is a post-authentication step corresponding to CVE-2025-57790.
author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (CommandLine LIKE '%qoperation%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%exec%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '% -af %' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%.xml %' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%\\Apache\\webapps\\ROOT\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%.jsp%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Suspicious Child Process of SolarWinds WebHelpDesk
description: Detects suspicious child processes spawned by SolarWinds WebHelpDesk (WHD) application, which may indicate exploitation activity leveraging RCE vulnerabilities such as CVE-2025-40551, CVE-2025-40536, or CVE-2025-26399
author: Huntress Team, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\WebHelpDesk\\bin\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\java.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\javaw.exe' ESCAPE '\') AND ParentCommandLine LIKE '%tomcat%' ESCAPE '\') AND (CommandLine LIKE '%-enc%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%base64%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%bitsadmin%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%certutil%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%curl%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%Invoke-RestMethod%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%Invoke-WebRequest%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%irm %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%iwr %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%mshta%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%msiexec%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%Net.WebClient%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%Start-BitsTransfer%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%wget%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%wmic%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Commvault QLogin Argument Injection Authentication Bypass (CVE-2025-57791)
description:
Detects the use of argument injection in the Commvault qlogin command - potential exploitation for CVE-2025-57791.
An attacker can inject the `-localadmin` parameter via the password field to bypass authentication and gain a privileged token.
author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (CommandLine LIKE '%qlogin%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '% -cs %' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '% -localadmin%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '% -clp %' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%\_localadmin\_\_%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Potential SharePoint ToolShell CVE-2025-53770 Exploitation Indicators
description:
Detects potential exploitation of CVE-2025-53770 by identifying indicators such as suspicious command lines discovered in Post-Exploitation activities.
CVE-2025-53770 is a zero-day vulnerability in SharePoint that allows remote code execution.
author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\w3wp.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND ((CommandLine LIKE '%cwBwAGkAbgBzAHQAYQBsAGwAMAAuAGEAcwBwAHgA%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%MAcABpAG4AcwB0AGEAbABsADAALgBhAHMAcAB4A%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%zAHAAaQBuAHMAdABhAGwAbAAwAC4AYQBzAHAAeA%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%c3BpbnN0YWxsMC5hc3B4%' ESCAPE '\') OR (CommandLine LIKE '%OgBcAFAAUgBPAEcAUgBBAH4AMQBcAEMATwBNAE0ATwBOAH4AMQBcAE0ASQBDAFIATwBTAH4AMQBcAFcARQBCAFMARQBSAH4AMQBcADEANQBcAFQARQBNAFAATABBAFQARQBcAEwAQQBZAE8AVQBUAFMA%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%oAXABQAFIATwBHAFIAQQB+ADEAXABDAE8ATQBNAE8ATgB+ADEAXABNAEkAQwBSAE8AUwB+ADEAXABXAEUAQgBTAEUAUgB+ADEAXAAxADUAXABUAEUATQBQAEwAQQBUAEUAXABMAEEAWQBPAFUAVABTA%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%6AFwAUABSAE8ARwBSAEEAfgAxAFwAQwBPAE0ATQBPAE4AfgAxAFwATQBJAEMAUgBPAFMAfgAxAFwAVwBFAEIAUwBFAFIAfgAxAFwAMQA1AFwAVABFAE0AUABMAEEAVABFAFwATABBAFkATwBVAFQAUw%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%OgBcAFAAUgBPAEcAUgBBAH4AMQBcAEMATwBNAE0ATwBOAH4AMQBcAE0ASQBDAFIATwBTAH4AMQBcAFcARQBCAFMARQBSAH4AMQBcADEANgBcAFQARQBNAFAATABBAFQARQBcAEwAQQBZAE8AVQBUAFMA%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%oAXABQAFIATwBHAFIAQQB+ADEAXABDAE8ATQBNAE8ATgB+ADEAXABNAEkAQwBSAE8AUwB+ADEAXABXAEUAQgBTAEUAUgB+ADEAXAAxADYAXABUAEUATQBQAEwAQQBUAEUAXABMAEEAWQBPAFUAVABTA%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%6AFwAUABSAE8ARwBSAEEAfgAxAFwAQwBPAE0ATQBPAE4AfgAxAFwATQBJAEMAUgBPAFMAfgAxAFwAVwBFAEIAUwBFAFIAfgAxAFwAMQA2AFwAVABFAE0AUABMAEEAVABFAFwATABBAFkATwBVAFQAUw%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%OgBcAFAAcgBvAGcAcgBhAG0AIABGAGkAbABlAHMAXABDAG8AbQBtAG8AbgAgAEYAaQBsAGUAcwBcAE0AaQBjAHIAbwBzAG8AZgB0ACAAUwBoAGEAcgBlAGQAXABXAGUAYgAgAFMAZQByAHYAZQByACAARQB4AHQAZQBuAHMAaQBvAG4AcwBcADEANQBcAFQARQBNAFAATABBAFQARQBcAEwAQQBZAE8AVQBUAFMA%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%oAXABQAHIAbwBnAHIAYQBtACAARgBpAGwAZQBzAFwAQwBvAG0AbQBvAG4AIABGAGkAbABlAHMAXABNAGkAYwByAG8AcwBvAGYAdAAgAFMAaABhAHIAZQBkAFwAVwBlAGIAIABTAGUAcgB2AGUAcgAgAEUAeAB0AGUAbgBzAGkAbwBuAHMAXAAxADUAXABUAEUATQBQAEwAQQBUAEUAXABMAEEAWQBPAFUAVABTA%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%6AFwAUAByAG8AZwByAGEAbQAgAEYAaQBsAGUAcwBcAEMAbwBtAG0AbwBuACAARgBpAGwAZQBzAFwATQBpAGMAcgBvAHMAbwBmAHQAIABTAGgAYQByAGUAZABcAFcAZQBiACAAUwBlAHIAdgBlAHIAIABFAHgAdABlAG4AcwBpAG8AbgBzAFwAMQA1AFwAVABFAE0AUABMAEEAVABFAFwATABBAFkATwBVAFQAUw%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%OgBcAFAAcgBvAGcAcgBhAG0AIABGAGkAbABlAHMAXABDAG8AbQBtAG8AbgAgAEYAaQBsAGUAcwBcAE0AaQBjAHIAbwBzAG8AZgB0ACAAUwBoAGEAcgBlAGQAXABXAGUAYgAgAFMAZQByAHYAZQByACAARQB4AHQAZQBuAHMAaQBvAG4AcwBcADEANgBcAFQARQBNAFAATABBAFQARQBcAEwAQQBZAE8AVQBUAFMA%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%oAXABQAHIAbwBnAHIAYQBtACAARgBpAGwAZQBzAFwAQwBvAG0AbQBvAG4AIABGAGkAbABlAHMAXABNAGkAYwByAG8AcwBvAGYAdAAgAFMAaABhAHIAZQBkAFwAVwBlAGIAIABTAGUAcgB2AGUAcgAgAEUAeAB0AGUAbgBzAGkAbwBuAHMAXAAxADYAXABUAEUATQBQAEwAQQBUAEUAXABMAEEAWQBPAFUAVABTA%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%6AFwAUAByAG8AZwByAGEAbQAgAEYAaQBsAGUAcwBcAEMAbwBtAG0AbwBuACAARgBpAGwAZQBzAFwATQBpAGMAcgBvAHMAbwBmAHQAIABTAGgAYQByAGUAZABcAFcAZQBiACAAUwBlAHIAdgBlAHIAIABFAHgAdABlAG4AcwBpAG8AbgBzAFwAMQA2AFwAVABFAE0AUABMAEEAVABFAFwATABBAFkATwBVAFQAUw%' ESCAPE '\'))) OR (CommandLine LIKE '%-EncodedCommand JABiAGEAcwBlADYANABTAHQAcgBpAG4AZwAgAD0%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%TEMPLATE\\LAYOUTS\\spinstall0.aspx%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Potential Exploitation of RCE Vulnerability CVE-2025-33053
description:
Detects potential exploitation of remote code execution vulnerability CVE-2025-33053
which involves unauthorized code execution via WebDAV through external control of file names or paths.
The exploit abuses legitimate utilities like iediagcmd.exe or CustomShellHost.exe  by manipulating
their working directories to point to attacker-controlled WebDAV servers, causing them to execute
malicious executables (like route.exe) from the WebDAV path instead of legitimate system binaries
through Process.Start() search order manipulation.
author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (((ParentProcessName LIKE 'C:\\Program Files\\internet explorer\\iediagcmd.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentProcessName LIKE 'C:\\Windows\\System32\\CustomShellHost.exe' ESCAPE '\') AND (CurrentDirectory LIKE '\\\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR CurrentDirectory LIKE '%\\DavWWWRoot\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\DavWWWRoot\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '\\\\%' ESCAPE '\') AND (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\route.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\netsh.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\makecab.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\dxdiag.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\ipconfig.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\explorer.exe' ESCAPE '\')) AND (NOT (NewProcessName LIKE 'C:\\Windows\\System32\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE 'C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\%' ESCAPE '\'))))

title: Potential Exploitation of CrushFTP RCE Vulnerability (CVE-2025-54309)
description: Detects suspicious child processes created by CrushFTP. It could be an indication of exploitation of a RCE vulnerability such as CVE-2025-54309.
author: Nisarg Suthar
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\crushftp.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (((NewProcessName LIKE '%\\powershell.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\powershell\_ise.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\pwsh.exe' ESCAPE '\') AND (CommandLine LIKE '%IEX%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%enc%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%Hidden%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%bypass%' ESCAPE '\')) OR (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cmd.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (CommandLine LIKE '%/c powershell%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%whoami%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%net.exe%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%net1.exe%' ESCAPE '\')) OR (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\bitsadmin.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\certutil.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\mshta.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cscript.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\wscript.exe' ESCAPE '\'))))

title: Exploitation Activity of CVE-2025-59287 - WSUS Deserialization
description: Detects cast exceptions in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) application logs that highly indicate exploitation attempts of CVE-2025-59287, a deserialization vulnerability in WSUS.
author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)
falsepositives: Legitimate WSUS operations that may trigger similar error messages
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Application' AND (Provider_Name='Windows Server Update Services' AND EventID=7053 AND (Data LIKE '%System.InvalidCastException%' ESCAPE '\' AND Data LIKE '%System.Windows.Data.ObjectDataProvider%' ESCAPE '\' AND Data LIKE '%Unable to cast object of type%' ESCAPE '\' AND Data LIKE '%System.Windows.Media.Brush%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Exploitation Activity of CVE-2025-59287 - WSUS Suspicious Child Process
description:
Detects the creation of command-line interpreters (cmd.exe, powershell.exe) as child processes of Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) related process wsusservice.exe.
This behavior is a key indicator of exploitation for the critical remote code execution vulnerability such as CVE-2025-59287, where attackers spawn shells to conduct reconnaissance and further post-exploitation activities.
author: Huntress Labs, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)
falsepositives: If this activity is expected, consider filtering based on specific command lines, user context (e.g., `nt authority\network service`), or parent process command lines to reduce noise.
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\wsusservice.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\w3wp.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND ParentCommandLine LIKE '%WsusPool%' ESCAPE '\')) AND (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cmd.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\powershell.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\pwsh.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\powershell\_ise.exe' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Potential Notepad++ CVE-2025-49144 Exploitation
description:
Detects potential exploitation of CVE-2025-49144, a local privilege escalation vulnerability in Notepad++ installers (v8.8.1 and prior) where the installer calls regsvr32.exe without specifying the full path.
This allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges by placing a malicious regsvr32.exe alongside this Legitimate Notepad++ installer.
The vulnerability is triggered when the installer attempts to register the NppShell.dll file, which is a component of Notepad++.
author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((NewProcessName LIKE '%\\regsvr32.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE 'regsvr32 /s%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%\\contextMenu\\NppShell.dll%' ESCAPE '\') AND (NOT (NewProcessName LIKE 'C:\\Windows\\System32\\regsvr32.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE 'C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\regsvr32.exe' ESCAPE '\'))))

title: Potential Exploitation of GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability
description:
Detects suspicious command execution by child processes of the GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) application, which may indicate exploitation such as CVE-2025-10035.
This behavior is indicative of post-exploitation activity related to CVE-2025-10035, as observed in campaigns by the threat actor Storm-1175.
author: MSFT (idea), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)
falsepositives: Legitimate administrative scripts or built-in GoAnywhere functions could potentially trigger this rule. Tuning may be required based on normal activity in your environment.
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\GoAnywhere\\tomcat\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND (((NewProcessName LIKE '%\\powershell.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\powershell\_ise.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\pwsh.exe' ESCAPE '\') AND ((CommandLine LIKE '%IEX%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%enc%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%Hidden%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%bypass%' ESCAPE '\') OR (CommandLine REGEXP 'net\s+user' OR CommandLine REGEXP 'net\s+group' OR CommandLine REGEXP 'query\s+session') OR (CommandLine LIKE '%whoami%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%systeminfo%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%dsquery%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%localgroup administrators%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%nltest%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%samaccountname=%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%adscredentials%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%o365accountconfiguration%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.DownloadString(%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%.DownloadFile(%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%FromBase64String(%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%System.IO.Compression%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%System.IO.MemoryStream%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%curl%' ESCAPE '\'))) OR ((NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cmd.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (CommandLine LIKE '%powershell%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%whoami%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%net.exe%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%net1.exe%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%rundll32%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%quser%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%nltest%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%curl%' ESCAPE '\')) OR (CommandLine LIKE '%bitsadmin%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%certutil%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%mshta%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%cscript%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%wscript%' ESCAPE '\')))))

title: Windows Suspicious Child Process from Node.js - React2Shell
description:
Detects suspicious child processes started by Node.js server processes on Windows, which may indicate exploitation of vulnerabilities like CVE-2025-55182 (React2Shell).
Attackers can abuse the Node.js 'child_process' module to run system commands or scripts using methods such as spawn(), exec(), execFile(), fork(), or execSync().
If execSync() or exec() is used in the exploit, the command line often shows a shell (e.g., cmd.exe /d /s /c ...) running a suspicious command unless other shells are explicitly invoked.
For other methods, the spawned process appears directly in the Image field unless a shell is explicitly used.
author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\node.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (ParentCommandLine LIKE '%--experimental-https%' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentCommandLine LIKE '%--experimental-next-config-strip-types%' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentCommandLine LIKE '%\\node\_modules\\next%' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentCommandLine LIKE '%next dev%' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentCommandLine LIKE '%next start%' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentCommandLine LIKE '%next" start%' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentCommandLine LIKE '%node\_modules\\.bin\\\\..\\next%' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentCommandLine LIKE '%react-scripts start%' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentCommandLine LIKE '%start-server.js%' ESCAPE '\')) AND ((((NewProcessName LIKE '%\\bash.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\bitsadmin.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\certutil.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cscript.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\curl.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\ipconfig.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\mshta.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\net.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\net1.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\netsh.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\nslookup.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\OpenConsole.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\perl.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\ping.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\powershell.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\pwsh.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\py.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\python.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\pythonw.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\pyw.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\reg.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\regsvr32.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\rundll32.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\sc.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\sh.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\systeminfo.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\wget.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\whoami.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\wmic.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\wscript.exe' ESCAPE '\' OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\wt.exe' ESCAPE '\') OR NewProcessName LIKE '%\\python%' ESCAPE '\') OR (CommandLine LIKE '%\\net%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%bitsadmin%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%certutil %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%conhost --headless%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%cscript %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%curl%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%ipconfig%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%java%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%lua%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%mshta%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%netsh%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%nslookup %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%perl%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%ping %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%powershell%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%pwsh%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%python%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%reg %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%reg.exe%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%regsvr32%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%ruby%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%rundll32%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%sc.exe%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%systeminfo%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%wget%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%whoami%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%wmic%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%wscript%' ESCAPE '\')) OR (NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cmd.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND (NOT CommandLine LIKE '%/d /s /c %' ESCAPE '\')) OR ((NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cmd.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%/d /s /c %' ESCAPE '\') AND (NOT (CommandLine LIKE '%git config --local --get remote.origin.url%' ESCAPE '\' OR (CommandLine LIKE '%netstat -ano | findstr /C:%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '% | findstr LISTENING%' ESCAPE '\') OR (CommandLine LIKE '%\\mkcert\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '% -install %' ESCAPE '\') OR (CommandLine LIKE '%\\mkcert\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '% -CAROOT%' ESCAPE '\')))))))

title: Suspicious Process Spawned by CentreStack Portal AppPool
description: Detects unexpected command shell execution (cmd.exe) from w3wp.exe when tied to CentreStack's portal.config, indicating potential exploitation (e.g., CVE-2025-30406)
author: Jason Rathbun (Blackpoint Cyber)
falsepositives: Potentially if other portal services run on w3wp with a apppool\portal\portal.config, if you want to increase scope you could add user IIS APPPOOL\portal.
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (ParentProcessName LIKE '%\\w3wp.exe' ESCAPE '\' AND ParentCommandLine LIKE '%\\portal\\portal.config%' ESCAPE '\' AND NewProcessName LIKE '%\\cmd.exe' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Potential EmpireMonkey Activity
description: Detects potential EmpireMonkey APT activity
author: Markus Neis, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (CommandLine LIKE '%/e:jscript%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%\\Local\\Temp\\Errors.bat%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Mustang Panda Dropper
description: Detects specific process parameters as used by Mustang Panda droppers
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), oscd.community
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (((CommandLine LIKE '%Temp\\wtask.exe /create%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%\%windir:~-3,1\%\%PUBLIC:~-9,1\%%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%/tn "Security Script %' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%\%windir:~-1,1\%%' ESCAPE '\') OR (CommandLine LIKE '%/E:vbscript%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%C:\\Users\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%.txt%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%/F%' ESCAPE '\')) OR NewProcessName LIKE '%Temp\\winwsh.exe' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Operation Wocao Activity
description: Detects activity mentioned in Operation Wocao report
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), frack113
falsepositives: Administrators that use checkadmin.exe tool to enumerate local administrators
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (CommandLine LIKE '%checkadmin.exe 127.0.0.1 -all%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name=powershell dir=in%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%cmd /c powershell.exe -ep bypass -file c:\\s.ps1%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%/tn win32times /f%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%create win32times binPath=%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%\\c$\\windows\\system32\\devmgr.dll%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '% -exec bypass -enc JgAg%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%type %keepass\\KeePass.config.xml%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%iie.exe iie.txt%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%reg query HKEY\_CURRENT\_USER\\Software\\%\\PuTTY\\Sessions\\%' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Operation Wocao Activity - Security
description: Detects activity mentioned in Operation Wocao report
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), frack113
falsepositives: Administrators that use checkadmin.exe tool to enumerate local administrators
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4799 AND TargetUserName LIKE 'Administr%' ESCAPE '\' AND CallerProcessName LIKE '%\\checkadmin.exe' ESCAPE '\')

title: Potential Baby Shark Malware Activity
description: Detects activity that could be related to Baby Shark malware
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND ((CommandLine LIKE '%powershell.exe mshta.exe http%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%.hta%' ESCAPE '\') OR (CommandLine LIKE '%reg query "HKEY\_CURRENT\_USER\\Software\\Microsoft\\Terminal Server Client\\Default"%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%cmd.exe /c taskkill /im cmd.exe%' ESCAPE '\' OR CommandLine LIKE '%(New-Object System.Net.WebClient).UploadFile(''http%' ESCAPE '\')))

title: Formbook Process Creation
description: Detects Formbook like process executions that inject code into a set of files in the System32 folder, which executes a special command command line to delete the dropper from the AppData Temp folder. We avoid false positives by excluding all parent process with command line parameters.
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), oscd.community, Jonhnathan Ribeiro
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (((ParentCommandLine LIKE 'C:\\Windows\\System32\\%' ESCAPE '\' OR ParentCommandLine LIKE 'C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\%' ESCAPE '\') AND ParentCommandLine LIKE '%.exe' ESCAPE '\') AND ((CommandLine LIKE '%/c%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%del%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%C:\\Users\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\%' ESCAPE '\') OR (CommandLine LIKE '%/c%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%del%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%C:\\Users\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%\\Desktop\\%' ESCAPE '\') OR (CommandLine LIKE '%/C%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%type nul >%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%C:\\Users\\%' ESCAPE '\' AND CommandLine LIKE '%\\Desktop\\%' ESCAPE '\')) AND CommandLine LIKE '%.exe' ESCAPE '\'))

title: Potential Snatch Ransomware Activity
description: Detects specific process characteristics of Snatch ransomware word document droppers
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
falsepositives: Scripts that shutdown the system immediately and reboot them in safe mode are unlikely
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND (EventID=4688 AND (CommandLine REGEXP 'shutdown\s+/r /f /t 00' OR CommandLine REGEXP 'net\s+stop SuperBackupMan'))

title: Potential Ursnif Malware Activity - Registry
description: Detects registry keys related to Ursnif malware.
author: megan201296
rule: SELECT * FROM logs WHERE Channel='Security' AND ((EventID=4657 AND OperationType='New registry value created') AND TargetObject LIKE '%\\Software\\AppDataLow\\Software\\Microsoft\\3A861D62-51E0-7C9D-AB0E-15700F2219A4' ESCAPE '\')

title: Potential Emotet Activity
description: Detects all Emotet like process executions that are not covered by the more generic rules
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
